title: Joshua Tree National Park: Night Sky Festival
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Calendar     Night Sky Festival               Night Sky Festival        NPS/Brad Sutton       Announcing Dates for the 2016 Night Sky Festival: October 28-30 The National Park Service, steward of Joshua Tree National Park and over 400 other park sites around the country, celebrates its 100th birthday in 2016. At Joshua Tree, we will continue our celebration of the NPS Centennial in October by bringing together astronomers, scientists, cultural speakers, night-sky enthusiasts, artists, volunteers, junior rangers, and members of nearby communities to celebrate the night skies of Joshua Tree National Park.   Watch this space for information about the 2016 Night Sky Festival.    Learn more about why national parks care about protecting dark night skies.      Park Partners The 2015 Joshua Tree National Park Night Sky Festival was brought to you through partnerships with Sky's the Limit Observatory and Nature Center, the Joshua Tree National Park Association, the Desert Institute, Celestron, Dark Ranger Telescope Tours, Bryce Canyon National Park, and Grand Canyon National Park.
